body_text.text: The majority of groups in the current study expressed their desire for a rare disease registry to be 429 established in NI. The disconnect between the health service and groups was mentioned and it was 430 suggested that a registry may help the health service to be more responsive to rare disease patient's 431 needs. The development of rare disease registries is growing which is remarkable given the scarcity of 432 patients [28] . A rare disease registry could be a powerful tool for rare disease patients, enabling long-433 term outcomes to be measured and ultimately improving care [29] .

Carers for individuals with a rare disease were frequently discussed -the main issue being that carers 500 are regularly overlooked and yet they often need support just as much as the person with the rare 501 disease that they are caring for. Living with a rare disease often involves many appointments and can 502 include travelling long distances to see specialists or receive treatments and so daily routine can be 503 disrupted for families [39] . This is particularly challenging in the era of COVID-19 as all hotels and 504 accommodation options within the UK are closed to everyone except NHS staff; families who normally 505 stay overnight for complex and / or tiring treatments are unable to do so, thus compromising care and 506 . FIGREF12.text: is an important factor to consider when developing rare disease support 420 In agreement with previous research, communication was found to be an important factor when 421 considering support for those with a rare disease [7]. Pelentsov et al. (2016) acknowledged how 422 challenging communication can be for those with a rare disease, particularly those who are newly 423 diagnosed [25]. Improved communication between General Practitioners (GP) and other healthcare 424 professionals would help better manage care for patients with rare disease(s). Rare disease registries 425 are an essential tool to measure the number of people affected by a rare disease(s) and thus contribute 426 to local evidence-based service planning. Such registries also improve knowledge and monitor 427 interventions for rare diseases and provide longer-term understanding for a specific disease [26, 27].

All of the groups surveyed or interviewed offer those with a rare 437 disease various means of communicating from helplines, to social media and websites. The rare disease patient 514 community has played a critical role, in response to these challenges, elevating patient voice and 515 mobilising legislation to support the development of programs that address the needs of patients with 516 rare diseases [42]. Parents will require specialist health literacy, care 518 giving skills and resources beyond those normally required by parents in general [25]. 519 520 Rare diseases result in a wide variety of healthcare needs [43]. Research on the experience of having a rare disease indicates that care and services needs 527 are often not determined simply by the severity of the health condition, but rather are a combination of 528 poor quality of care and barriers to access [47, 49]. Additionally, there was a focus on how collaborative groups use social media in relation to rare 99 disease(s). An online survey and individual interviews were conducted with representatives from rare 100 disease collaborative support groups as part of the evaluation phase of key priorities for action in the 101 Northern Ireland Rare Diseases Implementation Plan [5]. Ninety-nine respondents participated in the survey with 31 respondents providing detailed answers to 106 questions. The template survey is provided Additional file 1. The survey was open to all charities, voluntary and community groups providing services for people 110 living and working with rare diseases across Northern Ireland and anyone from within the group was 111 eligible to answer the survey. Detailed survey responses are provided in Additional file 2. All groups provided services to individuals living and working with rare diseases in Northern 115 Ireland and were established between 1980s to 2017.
